did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Walter Stainton papers, 1914-1983
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Professional papers, and records of the Cornell Dramatic Club; also student scrapbook.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Walter Stainton graduated from Cornell in the Class of 1920 and later returned as a professor of Speech and Drama. He was heavily involved on campus in the ROTC program and Cornell WEAI radio station but poured most of his resources into Cornell University Theatre. He eventually inherited the role of director from A.M. Drummond and was often consulted for assistance by other institutions with theatre construction and performance inquires. Stainton also led the university's film program and was deeply involved with the showing of new and classic films on campus. He was a member of multiple theatre and film organizations, including the Society for Cinema Studies and the National Board of Review of Motion Pictures. Stainton also focused specifically in his own work on Ithaca's past film industry and the history of film and theatre in Upstate New York.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook for 1916-1921 when Cornell undergraduate. Several documents and publications with scientific focus, specifically physics. Professional papers and correspondence concerning coursework in the Speech and Drama department and Cornell University Theatre. Scripts and statistical documents for Cornell Dramatic Club and Cornell Summer Theatre. Assorted papers concerning Cornell University ROTC, Cornell WEAI radio station, and other undergraduate organizations. Professional documents and correspondence addressing Ithaca and upstate New York area, focusing on theatre companies and performances. Technical and commercial publications, journal articles, and newspaper articles concerning theatre and film accomplishments, updates, and pop culture. International and national playbills and brochures for various theatre performances.

Stainton Cornell Undergraduate Scrapbook, 1916-1921
did.abstract: Stainton's scrapbook contains various pamphlets, pictures, newspaper articles, and other memorabilia about Cornell between 1916-1921. Among these one may find: a map of the Cornell campus; several examination booklets for subjects such as French, English, German, and Mathematics; programs for productions at the Lyceum Theatre; a form for the Alpha Theta Fraternity; papers and photos concerning involvement with the Military Training Association of the United States and Stainton's time in the United States Army School of Military Aeronautics at Cornell; flyers from several clubs, such as the Cornell University Christian Association, Cornell Rifle Club, and Cornell Dramatic Club; programs and articles concerning the 51st (including here a photo of Hermon Atkins MacNeil and his model of the upcoming Ezra Cornell Statue) and 52nd commencements; and various playbills from Cornell productions.
